meanings.sent1: The defiled fruit was not fit to eat.
meanings.sent2: The defiled water in the pond was unsafe for swimming.
meanings.sent3: The defiled sandwich had been left out in the sun for too long.
meanings.sent4: Her once pure white dress now looked defiled with mud stains.
meanings.sent5: The defiled room was filled with garbage and filth.

meanings.sent1: The defiled temple was no longer a place of worship.
meanings.sent2: The defiled hands needed a good wash after working in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The defiled snow had turned into a slushy mess.
meanings.sent4: His defiled reputation made it hard for him to find a job.
meanings.sent5: The defiled air in the city was thick with pollution.

meanings.sent1: The defiled document had been tampered with by unauthorized hands.
meanings.sent2: The defiled innocence of the child was a heartbreaking sight.
meanings.sent3: The defiled rules of the game led to chaos on the field.
meanings.sent4: His defiled trust in her was shattered when she betrayed him.
meanings.sent5: The defiled forest echoed with the sounds of destruction.
